Ok. The quickest solution is to change ownership of the mount point to your user. Right now that directory is owned by root, and only root has write permission. That's why you have been getting "permission denied" messages.
Get to a root shell and run this command:  chown carajean /home/carajean/drive2
Once you've done that, you will be able to write to that directory.
